results.title: Bush pilot: reflections on a Canadian myth
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott, Bob Lower and Norma Bailey
results.brief_description: For some bush pilots, flying is like playing solo violin at Carnegie Hall. For others, it’s like driving a taxi. This film shows how bush pilots are slowly being replaced. In northern towns built by bulldozers and jet aircraft, the emphasis is not on adapting to the north, but on remaking it in the image of the south. This is a thought provoking film about northern development.

results.title: Bush Mechanics animation (2015)
results.brief_description: In the central Australian desert, four Warlpiri men travel to visit a powerful elder at a remote outstation. On the road they must overcome mechanical mishaps and the trickery of a mischievous spirit. It will take all of their bush ingenuity to keep their car running and themselves alive.

constellations_other.name: Culture and identity on the Australian screen
constellations_other.description: Australian screen culture is distinctive, unexpected, playful and serious when it matters. Indigenous productions make a huge contribution to the unique identity of the Australian moving image.

results.title: Bush harvest
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian National Film Board and W. H. Shepherd
results.brief_description: Eucalyptus oil is distilled from the leaves of certain types of Australian eucalyptus trees. The film shows this being done by men who live and work in the bush and also some of the scientific research being carried out in order to determine the uses to which the different types of oil may be put. Photography: Frank Bagnall.

results.title: Bush doctor
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, ONF | NFB and Jean Palardy
results.brief_description: Flying physician, Dr Paul-Leon Rivard, paper company doctor at Clova, Quebec, has a practice overing 6000 patients scattered over 50,000 square km of the Abitibi region. He manages to cover the wilderness by plane, dog team and snowshoe, to help wherever needed.

results.title: Bush corridors
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Newfilms, South Australian Film Corporation and Justin Milne
results.brief_description: This film will be of interest to the general public but it is designed primarily for farmers to convince them of the necessity of leaving areas of scrub uncleared. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions and Ralph Smart
results.brief_description: Bush Christmas is a superb film which won critical acclaim around the world upon its release in 1947 and is today regarded as an Australian classic. In this 1971 re-edited version, a family of Australian children, realising their father’s horses have been stolen, set out to track the horse thieves and return the horses to their father as a Christmas present. A storm destroys their tracks and the children become lost, while search parties, and the horse thieves, desperately hunt for them. Starring Chips Rafferty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rank Organisation Film Productions and Ralph Smart

results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: ABFD, Children's Entertainment Films and Ralph Smart
results.brief_description: This brilliant Australian film depicts Yuletide life in country Australia in the 1940s. A family of children, whose father owns a horse farm, realise the horses have been stolen, so they set out to track the horse thieves in an effort to return the horses to their father as a Christmas present. A storm destroys their tracks and the children become lost, while search parties, and the horse thieves, one of which is played by Chips Rafferty, desperately hunt for them. This is a superb film which won critical acclaim around the world upon its release, and is regarded as an Australian classic. Narrated by John McCallum and filmed on location in the Blue Mountains and Burragorang Valley. Cast includes: John Fernside, Stan Tolhurst, Helen Grieve, Nicky Yardly, Edmund Allison.

results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, Gilda Baracchi, Paul D. Barron and Henri Safran
results.brief_description: It’s nearly Christmas and a group of children embark on a courageous and exciting adventure to rescue their stolen horse in time to take part in the big country race on New Year’s Day. This timeless story is a wonderful Australian film filled with adventure, comedy and a dash of romance. Stars Nicole Kidman and John Howard.

results.title: Bus Stop
results.creator_credit: Buddy Adler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Joshua Logan
results.brief_description: A naive, young cowboy coming to Phoenix for the big rodeo, falls in love with the first woman he sees. She happens to be Marilyn Monroe, playing a “chantoosie” in a cheap bar, and he has to almost kidnap her, get beaten up for her, and perform majestically in the rodeo before she reciprocates his love. Don Murray gives a boisterous performance as the cowboy in the big city, but Monroe steals the film in what is considered one of her best performances. Based on the play “Bus Stop” by William Inge.

results.title: Bus stop
results.brief_description:
This animation employs a fearless use of monochrome to enhance its sophisticated intertextual referencing of classic cartoons. The original music both supports and acts as a counterpoint to the storyline.
‘Fast lane’ performed by Lucid.
